trans-unit.source: A trigger action that changes the speed of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard"></xref>.
Use a SetStoryboardSpeedRatio action with an <xref:System.Windows.EventTrigger> or a <xref:System.Windows.Trigger> to interactively control a storyboard's speed ratio.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SetStoryboardSpeedRatio.SpeedRatio%2A> property of SetStoryboardSpeedRatio to specify a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> animation speed as a ratio of the old animation speed.

For example, if you set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SetStoryboardSpeedRatio.SpeedRatio%2A> to 2, you double the speed of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> animations and if you set a value of 0.5, you reduce the speed by 50 percent.
This object affects the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> at anytime after the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> begins.

For example, if you pause the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> and use the SetStoryboardSpeedRatio, when you resume the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard>, it uses the new speed ratio.

Rather, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.PauseStoryboard> must reference the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard>, which controls the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard>.

Pause, Resume, Stop, or Otherwise Control a Storyboard Interactively To be able to pause, resume, or otherwise control a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> interactively, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> property of its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> and use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ControllableStoryboardAction> object (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.PauseStoryboard>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ResumeStoryboard>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.StopStoryboard>) to control it by referencing its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> is unspecified, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> cannot be interactively controlled after it is begun.
See [How to: Use Event Triggers to Control a Storyboard After It Starts](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SetStoryboardSpeedRatio"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard"></xref> animation speed as a ratio of the old animation speed.
Use this property to specify a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> animation speed as a ratio of the old animation speed.
For example, if you set the SpeedRatio to 2, you double the speed of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> animations and if you set a value of 0.5, you reduce the speed by 50 percent.
